Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 3: Emergency Preparedness, Response & Recovery

Essential Record Maintenance

Child Identification Continuity of Operations

When planning for emergencies remember how important it is to maintain records.

The image on this slide is the front or top half of the Child Information Record. The full form is available on the LARA website. It is important to have this form or a comparable substitute for every child in your care. Be sure to take it with the dayâ€™s attendance roster if you need to evacuate and/or relocate. This could be an essential tool for monitoring children and ensuring reunification with families. In an emergency children should only be released to parents and authorized individuals with a photo ID.

It is also important to keep vital business records safe and secure. Records could be kept in a secure off-site location, in fire-proof storage, or under a password protected external drive. Access to these is necessary to maintain Continuity of Operations.
